• AI-powered local insights: EcoMind collects and analyzes data from IoT sensors, public datasets, and citizen reports to detect micro-climate patterns (e.g., heat zones, water wastage, tree cover loss).
  • Predictive action dashboard: Provides local authorities and NGOs with early alerts (e.g., “Air quality expected to cross safe limits tomorrow”) for preventive action.
  • Citizen engagement: Residents can report eco-issues (waste, air pollution, green cover loss) through an intuitive interface and receive AI-generated local eco-scores.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Communities around the world face localized environmental challenges — rising temperatures, urban heat islands, poor air quality, and inconsistent waste or water management. However, climate action data is fragmented and local governments often lack real-time insights to respond effectively. Citizens see environmental changes daily, but there’s no smart system that connects their observations with actionable insights or city responses. There is a clear gap between awareness and coordinated, data-driven climate action.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • ServiceNow Impact / ESG Management: For tracking environmental KPIs and sustainability goals.
  • Now Platform App Engine: To build the citizen portal, report workflows, and AI-driven dashboards.
  • ServiceNow Predictive Intelligence: To classify and prioritize environmental reports using machine learning.
  • ServiceNow Flow Designer: To automate responses and route alerts to relevant local departments or NGOs.
  • Performance Analytics: To visualize trends (air, water, waste metrics) and assess impact over time.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Data Feeds: Access to IoT sensor data (air quality, temperature, water levels), satellite data, or open municipal datasets.
  • AI Model Integration: Use of AI APIs (like Azure ML, TensorFlow, or Hugging Face models) for anomaly detection and prediction.
  • Mobile & Web Interfaces: Integration of ServiceNow workflows with a responsive citizen-facing app (React / Flutter).
  • Secure Cloud Hosting: ServiceNow cloud or partner integrations for scalable data handling.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Data availability: Real-time environmental data collection can be inconsistent or limited by region.
  • Integration complexity: Merging ServiceNow workflows with external IoT and AI systems may need careful API management.
  • Public engagement: Sustaining citizen participation and data accuracy requires strong UX and incentive design.
  • AI bias & validation: Ensuring AI models make fair and contextually correct recommendations for different localities.
  • Scalability: Handling data from multiple cities or regions efficiently within ServiceNow workflows.
